page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF WILTON AREA
page.content: Lazenby,Lackenby,Kirkleatham and Wilton comprise the major areas of settlement,these are long established villages,unlike the Whalehill Estate which provides an example of a re-housing programme.The area,though largely rural contains a large part of the giant I.C.I chemical complex. Inevitably I.C.I has had a significant effect on the people.It has provided employment but it has also brought with it the horrors of industrial pollution.The people,a high proportion of elderly,have spent most if not all,of their lives in the area,and though aware of todays problems,seem fairly contented. And of the future? In a nuclear age. Who knows?
